name: The Original Adventure
description: You are in search of the largest poop, negotiating the giant trolls of the forest, sand rooms of the dessicated desert and many more.

articles.name: Grass Sword
articles.info: Fight Win Heart 1

articles.name: Bone Club
articles.info: Fight Win Heart 1

articles.name: Shamshir
articles.info: +3 Attack

articles.name: Battle Axe
articles.info: +3 Attack

articles.name: Scorpion Stinger Club
articles.info: Poisonous, dangerous, awesome

articles.name: Badger Claw Knuckledusters
articles.info: Like brass knuckles, but with claws

articles.name: Grass Armor
articles.info: Fight Monster Heart 1

articles.name: Wood Shield
articles.info: Fight Monster Heart 1

articles.name: Plate Armor
articles.info: +2 Attack

articles.name: Duergar Dwarf Helmet
articles.info: +2 Defense

articles.name: Mining Helm
articles.info: +2 Defense

articles.name: Hatchet
articles.info: Single use, chops down a regular tree

articles.name: Pickaxe
articles.info: Single use, breaks up a regular rock

articles.name: Oily Torch
articles.info: Use once, take one less damage in fight

articles.name: Dynamite
articles.info: Single use, explodes a big tree or rock

articles.name: Water Skin
articles.info: Single use, refills your canteen

articles.name: Grass Potion
articles.info: Tastes terrible, but restores one heart

articles.name: Desert Balm
articles.info: Smells of spices. Restore two hearts.

articles.name: First Aid Kit
articles.info: Bandages etc, restore three hearts

articles.name: Ice Ointment
articles.info: +3 hearts - may just be ice cream

articles.name: Tundra Potion
articles.info: Rancid seal flavor, -4 hearts

articles.name: Lava Potion
articles.info: Maybe not one you should drink

articles.name: Desert Thobe
articles.info: Desert robes protect against the sand mites

articles.name: Desert Scarf
articles.info: Desert scarf protect against the sun

articles.name: Crampons
articles.info: Foot daggers to help you grip the ice

articles.name: Ice Axe
articles.info: A mountaineering axe

articles.name: Camping Gear
articles.info: Flint, steel, oil stove, tent, and blanket

articles.name: Mittens
articles.info: They go on your hands silly

articles.name: Snowsuit
articles.info: Warm and comfy, like snow pajamas

articles.name: Snowshoes
articles.info: Shoes, but for walking on snow

articles.name: Cool Pants
articles.info: Insulated pants to keep your hiney cool

articles.name: Rubber Boots
articles.info: These keep your feel from buring up

articles.name: Heat Goggles
articles.info: Protects you from fire monster attacks

articles.name: Grass Coin
articles.info: Collectible! Collect em all!

articles.name: Cave Coin
articles.info: Collectible! Collect em all!

articles.name: Desert Coin
articles.info: Printed with the face of an ancient king

articles.name: Mountain Coin
articles.info: Older than the hills, ancient iron

articles.name: Ice Coin
articles.info: Made of ice that does melt

articles.name: Tundra Coin
articles.info: Made of ice that never melts

articles.name: Lava Coin
articles.info: Literally burns a hole in your pocket

articles.name: Diamond
articles.info: Shiny and captivating

articles.name: Ruby
articles.info: Blood red, like your gaping wounds

articles.name: Opal
articles.info: Multicolored ore will make you rich

articles.name: Map Fragment
articles.info: Collect all 4, find burried treasure (4 coins)

articles.name: Shrinking Spell
articles.info: Single use, shrinks monster to 1-heart foe.

articles.name: Pet Mouse
articles.info: Such a cute little mousie! In your pocket

articles.name: Pet Lizard
articles.info: You found this fellow hiding under a rock

articles.name: Pet Stone Golem
articles.info: Like the big one, but little! In your pocket

articles.name: Pet Wooly Snake
articles.info: When they aren't giant, they are cute :)

articles.name: Pet Fire Fox
articles.info: They are nice if you raise them from a pup

articles.name: Grass Wand
articles.info: Intricately twisted grasses, unknown magic.

articles.name: Cactus Wand
articles.info: Careful there - this one is spikey

articles.name: Dowsing Rod
articles.info: A mining tool to find natural springs, can be used to refill your water skin anywhere.

articles.name: Ice Crown
articles.info: You feel like growing a beard and flying.

articles.name: Lava Bucket
articles.info: Mining away song, this bucket will be handy.

articles.name: Genie Bottle
articles.info: Three wishes to change any map tile

articles.name: Dragon Lightning Sword
articles.info: This is an awesome +5 weapon.

articles.name: Bathrobe
articles.info: Who left a bathrobe out here in the wild?

articles.name: Dirty Old Toothbrush
articles.info: At least your teeth will be clean!

articles.name: The Latest iPhone Phone Phone
articles.info: No chargers anywhere though

articles.name: The Secret Box of Secrets
articles.info: What is in the box anyways? It will not open no matter how hard you try. Sometimes it emits strange sounds.

articles.name: Candied Gopher Poops
articles.info: A rare delicacy from the Evil Gopher

articles.name: Mangy Squirrel Pelt
articles.info: This rabid squirrel pelt smells bad

articles.name: Pet Hidey Cat
articles.info: Once defeated, it is a loyal pet

articles.name: Beefy Bison Burger Boots
articles.info: Waste no part of the bison please

articles.name: Spiky Berries of Ouchiness
articles.info: The spiky bush had spiky berries

articles.name: Frog Tongue Rope
articles.info: A giant frog tongue makes a good rope

articles.name: Sentient Mud Sample Jar
articles.info: You kept some to take home with you

articles.name: Swamp Goblin Friendship
articles.info: Once defeated, you become friends

articles.name: Stinky Skunk Pelt
articles.info: What will you do with all this fur

articles.name: Even Moar Mangy Squirrel Pelts
articles.info: You collected the whole gang of pelts

articles.name: Moose Antler Back-Scratcher
articles.info: What better use for these antlers

articles.name: Pet Angry Tree Rootling
articles.info: You will raise it to be kind

articles.name: Giant Worm Guts
articles.info: Maybe you will need these later

articles.name: Awesome Snake Head
articles.info: This tunnel snake head looks cools

articles.name: Slimy Cave Slime Treasure
articles.info: Still slimy, this gold was inside it

articles.name: Spiky Root Sap Syrup
articles.info: Like maple syrup, but spicier

articles.name: Baby Stone Golem Poops
articles.info: They look like diamonds, but are they?

articles.name: Bespoke Lawyer Suit
articles.info: If you need to look good you can now

articles.name: Cave Bear Hat
articles.info: Looks awesome with a lawyer suit

articles.name: Scarab Beetle Brooch
articles.info: You can clasp your cloak with this

articles.name: Ant Lion Poison
articles.info: One of the rarest poisons on earth

articles.name: Nomad Raider Loyalty
articles.info: For sparing their lives, they are loyal

articles.name: Undead Wight Treasure Loot
articles.info: Silver buckles and golden rings

articles.name: Three Cursed Djinni Wishes
articles.info: You won - you get three cursed wishes

articles.name: Magic Sand Golem Sand
articles.info: It writhes and moves in the bottle

articles.name: Cactus Root Fruity Fruit
articles.info: Delicious and refreshing

articles.name: Sandy Wormy Toothy Thing
articles.info: Could make a letter opener maybe

articles.name: Wormy Sandy Sand
articles.info: You keep it in the golem sand bottle

articles.name: Mummy Curse
articles.info: You wonder what the curse will be

articles.name: Skeleton Guard Clipboard
articles.info: Now yu can do bureaucracy too

articles.name: Pillager Mountain Map
articles.info: Not good for much but looks cool

articles.name: Great Raven Feathers
articles.info: You wear them like an awesome cloak

articles.name: Mountain Ogre Loincloth
articles.info: Why did you choose to keep this?

articles.name: Dire Wolf Skull
articles.info: Wear it on your shoulder like armor

articles.name: Stone Troll Skull Bell
articles.info: Ring it to scare away trolls

articles.name: Goblin Miner Friendship
articles.info: You are collecting goblin friends!

articles.name: Acid Slime Super Acid Jar
articles.info: Use this slime to cut glass!

articles.name: Drow Elf Coins and Potions
articles.info: Arcane figures cover these objects

articles.name: Surly Attitude and Acne
articles.info: How kind of teenagers to share these

articles.name: Arctic Hare Pelt
articles.info: You almost have nough for a coat

articles.name: Snow Weasel Pelt
articles.info: These are so soft and fluffy!

articles.name: Tundra Bear Skin Coat
articles.info: Lined with your other pelts, so comfy

articles.name: Walrus Tusk Walking Stick
articles.info: Looks awesome as you walk along

articles.name: Magic Snowman Hat
articles.info: You can bring (evil) Frosty to life

articles.name: Knowledge of the Ice Giant
articles.info: Now you know if it was made of ice

articles.name: Snow Ant Colony
articles.info: It is fun to watch them dig

articles.name: Dead Explorer Goggles
articles.info: They help block the icy wind

articles.name: Ice Worm Tooth Necklace
articles.info: Stays cold even in the bright sun

articles.name: Diamond Troll Diamonds
articles.info: He ran off but left these behind

articles.name: Ice Dragon Scales
articles.info: You saw them on your shirt as armor

articles.name: Lava Lizard Skin Gloves
articles.info: Protects your hands from lava

articles.name: Phoenix Feather
articles.info: Looks so cool, does nothing useful

articles.name: Murder Hornet Stingers
articles.info: Seems like these could be useful later

articles.name: Lava Golem Scientific Sample
articles.info: In a special jar for doing science to

articles.name: Red Dragon Scales
articles.info: May as well sew these on too

articles.name: Zealous Acolyte Hymnal
articles.info: Now you can sing ARG-LAG B-LUGWA

articles.name: Insanity of the Elder Gods
articles.info: You won, or did you? You do not feel as sane as you did before defeating it.

fights.name: Evil Gopher
fights.info: Angry, hungry, probably evil. A gopher pops out of the ground ready to rumble and make you regret your day.

fights.name: Rabid Squirrel
fights.info: The rabid squirrel is not going to let the gophers have all the fun.  It is convinced you are stealing acorrns, and it looks quite fierce.

fights.name: Hidey Cat
fights.info: What a cute little kitty, hiding in the grass! Only it is not little, and it is hiding so it can pounce on you and play with you like a rag dog.

fights.name: Angry Bison
fights.info: You probably should not have worn bright red trousers, as it seems to have enraged this very, very large bison.

fights.name: Spiky Bush
fights.info: Your toughest opponent yet. Spikey bush pokes you with thorns and hurts a lot. It does not know it is fighting you - it is just a bush.

fights.name: Swamp Goblin
fights.info: Some of your best friends are goblins! You tell this to the goblin that jumps out at you, waving a stick and threatening your life. It bites your finger and does not let go.

fights.name: Stinky Skunk
fights.info: Stinky! Nuff said.

fights.name: Squirrel Gang
fights.info: Remember that rabid squirrel from the grasslands? His forest cousins are even crazier!

fights.name: Grass Golem
fights.info: The Grass Golem looks so cute lumbering about the plains. Aww, look at it devour that cute little bunny. Wait, what? Oh no, it saw us!

fights.name: Giant Worm
fights.info: A happy dirt eating pink night-crawler, just like you put on your fish hooks. But as big as the tunnel. Not evil exactly, just omnivorous.

fights.name: Tunnel Snake
fights.info: You thought you had learned not to step on snakes, but unfortunately you did not learn. Ouch!

fights.name: Slimy Cave Slime
fights.info: No self respecting adventurer can go home without having defeated a slime monster of some sort. This is your moment. No one tells you how gross and slimy it really is.

fights.name: Nasty Goblin
fights.info: Once again you announce your love and support of goblins and goblin-kind.  This goblin sits down to listen, then tries to stab you in the back.

fights.name: Spiky Bush Roots
fights.info: The spiky bush is even spikier on the bottom parts, filling these caves and tunnels with crazy ouchy tentacle roots.

fights.name: Small Stone Golem
fights.info: What a cute little stone golem! It barely reaches your knees which it is punching and hitting. Ouch that hurts! Stop it cute litte stone golem!

fights.name: Subterranean Lawyers
fights.info: A horde of lawyers in bespoke suits runs around the corner, threatening subpoenas and lawsuits unless you hand over your treasure. You appeal to the court of butt-kicking.

fights.name: Cave Bear
fights.info: A bear. In a cave. A cave bear in a cave. It feels like a smaller cave now, what with this giant hungry bear coming after you.

fights.name: Stone Golem
fights.info: The Stone Golem does not take kindly to people ransacking through its dark cave system. It does not take kindly to anyone, actually. You learn this when you bump into it in the deepest recesses of the caves.

fights.name: Scarab Beetles
fights.info: Giant dung beetles, flinging dung at you. Why do people fill ancient temples with these, you wonder, as you dodge rotten feces.

fights.name: Giant Ant Lion
fights.info: This is not a sand dune, it is an ant lion pit. You see the giant larvae at the bottom, poison slathering its pincers, and shudder in fear as you slide towards it.

fights.name: Nomad Raiders
fights.info: Ambushed! Raiders spring from the sand, with their eyes on your treasure and water.

fights.name: Undead Wight
fights.info: These husks of former adventurers who did not surviv the desert crossing are angry at you for existing. Raised from the dead in ancient temples, they want you to join their ranks.

fights.name: Djinni Bottle
fights.info: A golden lamd, lying in the sand. You rub it, eager for your three wishes. The Djinni that emerges wants you to take its place - unless you can defeat it.

fights.name: Sand Golem
fights.info: You start to wonder who left all these golems running about mucking things up. You would like to have a word with them. The golem says nothing as it mashes you with sandy arms.

fights.name: Giant Vulture
fights.info: The vultures were indeed watching you carefully. One of them is not willing to wait until you die all by yourself. As it soars down from above, you realize it is ten feet tall. Good luck!

fights.name: Sandy Wormy Thing
fights.info: This wormy thing is quite sandy, probably because it is a (hungry) worm in sand.

fights.name: Wormy Sandy Thing
fights.info: This sandy thing seems pretty wormy - but it is made out of sand. It is also hungry.

fights.name: Evil Undead Wight
fights.info: This undead wight is not the cheerful scone baking kind, but more the killing you while cackling kind.

fights.name: Mummy of the Mummy
fights.info: You want your own mummy when the mummy of the mummy mumbles something about the curse of the temple.

fights.name: Spiky Cactus Roots
fights.info: What is it with spiky ouchy roots? Even here in the desert, you find yourself battling many spiky things.

fights.name: Skeleton Guard
fights.info: This one is a real bureaucrat, and your paperwork is not in order. You did not know you needed a temple raiding form submitted in triplicate.

fights.name: Mi-Go the Temple Crab
fights.info: This crab seems to be from another world, it seems crab like but also alien. It is muttering ancient phrases that feel full of power, the chattering is driving you mad. Can you defeat Mi-Go before you lose your sanity?

fights.name: Giant Scorpion
fights.info: Just like it says on the tin - this here is one giant scorpion, with a big spiky tail and far too many legs.

fights.name: Lone Pillager
fights.info: Every mountain range has its share of bandits hiding in the hills. This fellow aims to eat your food, steal your treasure, and wear your skin as a coat. You politely suggest that this not happen. You agree to disagree, violently.

fights.name: Great Raven
fights.info: A wise beast, about thrice your size, it considers all ground dwellers variations of mice to be eaten.

fights.name: Mountain Ogre
fights.info: The mountaineer's guide says ogres eat people. You wonder how the ecology works with so few people and so many ogres. Maybe they eat scorpions.

fights.name: Dire Wolf
fights.info: These extinct canines are huge and strong. And apparently not extinct, as this mama wolf does her best to feed you to her cute little slobbering puppies.

fights.name: Stone Troll
fights.info: That cave did not go underground - it was a trail nest. Do ythey lay eggs, you wonder, making a note in your notebook while dodging troll club bludgeon attacks.

fights.name: Mountain Giant
fights.info: The Mountain Giant loves adventures. It loves them in sandwiches, in stews, and on great crackers. You try convincing him to go vegan, but he just goes and eats vegans. You decide you need to end his reign of terror.

fights.name: Rabid Badger
fights.info: Of all the fearsome critters about, a badger is about the most fierce. Even the cave bears stay away.

fights.name: Goblin Miners
fights.info: You are starting to feel bad about all the goblin murdering you have been doing, but these miners leave you no choice, as they wildly swing their pickaxes at you. Gain +2 pickaxes.

fights.name: Acid Slime
fights.info: This slime lumbers about the caves, corroding and digesting rock and any creatures that get in its way.

fights.name: Duergar Dwarf
fights.info: These gray dwarves are known for their slave trading ways - they will not work hard if they can enslave others and make them work instead. If you lose, at least you will be alive (though as their slave, you will wish you were not).

fights.name: Drow Elf Party
fights.info: Dark hair, pale skinned, these elves look mean. They take prisoners too, but for the purpose of blood sacrifice. It is probably best if you win.

fights.name: Teenagers
fights.info: Bad attitudes, crazy clothes, and they are spray painting crude phrases on the cave walls. Teens mean trouble.

fights.name: Cave Horror
fights.info: Deep down in the deep down deeppy dark downy down, you stat to be afraid. It is right to be afraid. Be afraid. The cave horror is here waiting for you to stumble into its lair. Good luck!

fights.name: Arctic Hare
fights.info: Like the bunny from Monty Python and the Search for the Holly Grail, but bigger and far more dangerous. You do not have a Holdy Hand Grenade, but dynamite takes them out in a pinch.

fights.name: Snow Weasel
fights.info: A pack of snow white weasels are hunting you, popping up here and there from snow tunnels. Fast and bitey, but oh so cute.

fights.name: Tundra Bear
fights.info: Like a polar bear, but more tundra-like. What is tundra like? Big, toothy, smart, and hungry. Tundra colored.

fights.name: Crazed Walrus
fights.info: This walrus is in the wrong place - the tundra is far from the ocean. Is it amorous or angry? Either way, it is coming for you and you are concerned.

fights.name: Magic Snowman
fights.info: Top hat, carrot stick nose, razor sharp stick arms - some chaotic evil snow wizard had too much fun.

fights.name: Ice Giant
fights.info: Is an ice giant a giant made of ice, or a giant who lives in the icy north? You ask politely, which only angers it further. You can find out after you dispatch it.

fights.name: Wooly Snake
fights.info: You saw wooly muskox on your tundra trip. The wooly snake is oh so much larger, towering over you. It might be an herbivore! You offer it some carrots. It sniffs them, then attempts to eat you. Not an herbivore. Time to fight for your life!

fights.name: Snow Ants
fights.info: Is ther nowhere in the world free of ants? These ants are ruthlessly efficient at gathering nutrients for their queen - and you are a bunch of nutrients.

fights.name: Dead Explorer
fights.info: This freozen explorer looks worse for the wear, but found it too cold to die completely - wandering around trying to steal back warmth from the living.

fights.name: Ice Worm
fights.info: Sharp rows of teeth for chewing through ice, you almost wish the wooly snake were here instead.

fights.name: Ice Horror
fights.info: Everything this creature touches freezes, in grotesque pastures. You see icy statues of past explorers who failed to succeed in the fight.

fights.name: Diamond Troll
fights.info: The smartest of all trolls, Diamond Troll is stalking you through the caverns, his brilliant armored sides rendering him near invisible among the icy walls.

fights.name: Ice Dragon
fights.info: Your classic blue-scaled, ice-breathing, large-taloned, smart, hungry, and greedy dragon. You just wonder why there are so many of them in these caverns.

fights.name: Gnoph-Kew
fights.info: What is this even? It seems to be a six legged narwhal polar bear, or something. It is hungry, and definitely evil. Win or die!

fights.name: Fire Fox
fights.info: Red fur constantly aflame, this quick footed foe nips at your heels and will not leave you alone.

fights.name: Lava Lizard
fights.info: These cold blooded creatures are hot and quick after soaking in a lave pool all afternoon - you have never seen a lizard move so quickly. And lizards generally move quickly.

fights.name: Phoenix
fights.info: They seem to be migrating through here, burning themselves up then coming back to life again.

fights.name: Murder Hornets
fights.info: You read articles about these, but it did not mention they are twice your size and angry all the time.

fights.name: Lava Golem
fights.info: Enought with the golems already. How exactly are you supposed to defeat a 10 foot tall creature of molten lava? You better figure out fast, or else.

fights.name: Red Dragon
fights.info: Dragon. Red. Fire. Run!

fights.name: Livid Lavamancers
fights.info: These Lavamancers are determined to keep the secrets of lava magic to themselves and will do anything to accomplish their goals. It does not help that you chastised them for sacrificig cute kittens to the lava gods-now they are truly angry. At least you saved a few kitties. Can you also save yourself?

fights.name: Orc Raider
fights.info: You made it all this way without killing an orc, but your luck ran out.

fights.name: Steam Slime
fights.info: Enough with the slimes. Is this even a slime? Less substantive and more substantial, this slime has transmogrified itself to an angry steam cloud.

fights.name: Sentient Lava
fights.info: Close cousin to sentient mud, this lava climbs out of tis bubling pool to make adventurer barbecue skewers.

fights.name: Zealous Acolytes
fights.info: Chanting strange words, these acolytes are hastening the end of the world as they worship their demented elder god.

fights.name: Evil Sorcerer
fights.info: Are there any good sorcerers? Not this one. Cackling maniacally, thought it feels a bit forced. Get him talking, then take him down while he rambles on about his evil plans for world domination.

fights.name: Elder God
fights.info: Cthulhu has nothing on this creature. Why did those zealous welcome this thing to our plane of existence? Well, you will just have to take the garbage out, or to the nearest dimensional portal at any rate. World ending death gods have no place in our well ordered universe - at least if you have anything to say about it!

fights.name: Some Kind of Monster Thing
fights.info: I am a descriptive block of text talking about this very interesting and snarkily funny some kind of monster thing. It is totally different than the monster in the snow caverns. Really, promise.
